Candidate :  Auric a Propa  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Belgium - Bruss els 
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
Postgraduate studies: Master of Arts in European Economic Studies College o f Europe, Bruges, 
Belgium 09/1999 -06/2000  
 
Degree in International Economic Relations  Academy of Economic Studies of Moldova, Chisinau 
09/1991 -06/1996  
 
Languages  
English: Fluent  
French: Very good  
Romanian: Fluent   
Russian: Fluent  
German & Italian: Basic understanding  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
August 2020 to date European Sepsis Alliance ( part of the Global Sepsis Alliance)  
Position: Co-Chair, Patients & Family Working Group  
• Advocacy on public health policies in Europe  
• Awareness -raising on holistic treatment of post -sepsis sequela e and standardized sepsis 
management practices  
• Moderation of a panel discussion at World Sepsis Congress 2021: “The Missing Stories: 
Families and Survivors of Sepsis and COVID -19” 
 
April 2008 to July 2020 Arcello rMittal  
Position: Deputy Head of European Affairs  
• Set up Brussels office; drove cross -functional collaboration at all corporate levels and key 
business functions in 9 EU countries  
• Developed and led corporate government affairs strategies on industrial transformation, climate 
and energy, circular economy, CCSUS and innovation  
• Advised sen ior leaders on proposed regulatory changes that impact global business; supported 
their engagement with EU Commissioners and national ministers and heads of government, 
MEPs, NGOs and think -tanks.  
• Advanced the company's interest via business/trade associ ations and alliances; creating ad -hoc 
business and strategic relationship building.  
 • Secured €300 million R&D and innovation subsidies in partnership with EC (Horizon Europe), 
EIB and national authorities.  
 
Dec 2007 to March 2008 Waggener Edstrom Worldwide Consultancy  
Position: Senior Account Manager  
Creation of internal structures, staff manageme nt & business development  
 
April 2001 to Nov 2007  Weber Shandwick Public Affairs Consultancy  
Position:  Senior Consultant  
Development and execution of advocacy strategies and campaigns for US and other multinational 
clients, focusing on FMCG, energy and environment . 
 
Oct 2000 to March 2001 European Commission (DG ECFIN)  
Position: Intern  
Hands -on experience in EU policy making in a multicultural environ ment  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
• Masters Degree in European Economic Studies, College of Europe, Bruges  
• Entrepreneurial EU Public Affairs professional with extensive experience in designing and 
executing advocacy strategies and campaigns on sustaina bility, climate , energy and consumer 
policies  
• Ability to understand and connect complex EU and global policy developments and translate 
them into business impacts/growth opportunities (e.g. EU Green Deal, circular economy, 
economic recovery plan)  
• Strong interpersonal skills - ability to establish trust - collaborative - results -oriented - responsible  
 
Interests & Volunteer Experience  
• 05/2021 - 07/2022 Syntropic Enterprise advanced Master Class, Australia Online course on 
building new models of enterprises for a world with a future  
• 09/2020 - 06/202 1 Mentor at the Professional Women International (PWI) programme - Helping 
professional women grow and succeed  
• 2012 - 2020 “Talent Pipeline” and “Women in Leadership Programme” – ArcelorMittal’s 
executive training programmes designed for future leaders, de livered by Duke Corporate 
Education  
• 04/1997 -06/1997 Cambridge Language School, UK Course on communication skills & cross -
cultural differences  
• 05/1997 -07/1997 Barclays Bank, Cambridge, UK Small business development and growth  
 
For further information please contact  Jan Johnston or Julie Smith  on 01695 5 70 6 96 or email 
julie.smith @johnston -vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
